subitems.name: Ultramarine Linux
subitems.description: Ultramarine Linux is a Fedora-based Linux distribution designed to stay out of your way and be easy to use. All editions come with several tweaks preapplied to make initial setup and daily usage seamless.

subitems.name: Ultramarine Plasma Edition
subitems.description: (Recommended) A community favorite with an Ultramarine twist. Simple defaults and wide-ranging customizations.

subitems.name: Ultramarine Xfce Edition
subitems.description: A lightweight and elegant experience designed to help you squeeze the most out of your device, or revive an old one.

subitems.name: Ultramarine Budgie Edition
subitems.description: A familiar and stylish experience with a bit of flair.

subitems.name: Ultramarine GNOME Edition
subitems.description: A simple, elegant, and intuitive desktop with a large ecosystem of apps and extensions.

subitems.description: A security-oriented, lightweight Linux distribution based on musl libc and busybox

subitems.name: Bass OS
subitems.description: A new take on Android for the Raspberry Pi, bringing the dynamic nature of Bass OS/Bliss OS to the ARM platform using Bass Toolkit to compile one source with multiple variants

subitems.name: Bass ARM (Android)
subitems.description: A new take on Android for the Raspberry Pi, bringing the dynamic nature of Bass OS/Bliss OS to the ARM platform using Bass Toolkit to compile one source with multiple variants

subitems.name: Bass TabletGo IOT/IIOT - Android 14 (RPi 4B, CM4, 400) - SD Card Only
subitems.description: AOSP based Android OS. Includes standard Tablet UI with minimal functionality with KernelSU, MicroG and FOSS app stores

subitems.name: Bass Desktop Mode - Android 14 (RPi 4B, CM4, 400) - SD Card Only
subitems.description: Minimal AOSP based Android OS. Includes SmartDock based Desktop mode with multi-window enabled, with KernelSU, MicroG and FOSS app stores

subitems.name: Bass Restricted Mode - Android 14 (RPi 4B, CM4, 400) - SD Card Only
subitems.description: Minimal AOSP based Android OS. A Lockdown/Admin (UBoot boot modes) based build with the free version of Restricted Launcher (a Kiosk launcher), KernelSU, MicroG and FOSS app stores

subitems.name: Bass Desktop PC - Android 16 QPR1 (RPi 5, 500, 500+) - SD Card Only
subitems.description: Minimal AOSP based Android OS. Includes SmartDock based Desktop mode with multi-window and multi-display enabled, MicroG, Aurora Store and FOSS app stores (30 day demo, unlockable license)

subitems.name: Bass Tablet UI - Android 16 (RPi 5, 500, 500+) - SD Card Only
subitems.description: Minimal AOSP based Android OS. Includes Android Tablet UI with multi-window enabled, MicroG, Aurora Store and FOSS app stores (30 day demo, unlockable license)

subitems.name: openHABian (32 bit)
subitems.description:
Fallback version. This version can be used for RPIs with less than 2 GB of memory.
Be prepared that you might run into issues when you attempt to run openHAB 5.
Parts of 5 requires a 64 bit OS and Java. You can run openHAB 4 with this image.
